./.title: Overview
./.body:
Overview
This is a ODA documentation.
ODA is GraphQL-based develpment platform. With it you can quickly create api server

development-issues/development-process.h.title: Getting start
development-issues/development-process.h.body:
Links
ODA using next technology
ApolloData
GraphQL
TypeScript
Mongoose
Model associations based on Sequelize

development-issues/quick-install-guide.h.title: Quick install guide
development-issues/quick-install-guide.h.body:
Development Environment
For working with Oda system, on user’s PC should be installed:
Nodejs - version 7 or above;
NVM (Node Version Manager);
MongoDB
NPM (Node Package Manager).
ODA API
VS Code (Visual Studio Code).
Install Nodejs.
Check if Nodejs version 7 or above is installed on your PC. 
In terminal window run command:
 node --version

If you get message that nodejs is not installed, you should install it:
In terminal window run command:
curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/creationix/nvm/v0.33.2/install.sh | bash

Note: If you get nvm:
command not found
after running the install script, your system may not have a [.bash_profile file] where the command is set up.
Simply create one with touch ~/.bash_profile and run the install script again. 
More detailed information about nodejs can be found here 
Now install Nodejs, run in terminal:
nvm install v7; 
nvm use v7

Install MongoDB.
Check if MongoDB is installed on your PC.
In terminal window, run command: 
mongo --version

If you get the message that mongodb is not installed, you should install it in terminal:
https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/tutorial/install-mongodb-on-os-x/

Now run MongoDB in terminal:
sudo mongod

Note: If you get an error “shutting down with code 100”, open your root folder - cd / - and then create required folder - sudo mkdir data/db
Note: For OSX, MongoDB should be running every time. On Linux, MongoDB is running automatically, after system reboot.
Install ODA
Open another terminal window.
Install typescript (variation of javascript, needed for working with typescript files):
npm install -g typescript

Install Yeoman and generator-oda-api-simple using npm in terminal:
sudo npm install -g yo
sudo npm install -g generator-oda-api-simple

Install developer environment

VSCode (Visual Studio Code).

For comfortable work with code, we recommend to install  Visual Studio Code (VSCode).
The project contains all settings to the editor. It make the code environment feel and look the same between different developers. 
Note: that installing of VSCode is highly recommended, but is not necessary. You can also use any text editor like Sublime, Atom, Notepad++, etc.

development-issues/write-fisrt-oda-app/c.title: Creating project
development-issues/write-fisrt-oda-app/c.body:
Create project.
Generate your new project 
yo oda-api-simple

Go to project folder (instead of  use the name of your project):
cd 

Now run project:
npm start

Open web browser. 
Go to localhost:3003/graphiql to check that everything is working.

development-issues/write-fisrt-oda-app/b.title: Base project map
development-issues/write-fisrt-oda-app/b.body:
File generators
Some part of project generate from src files.
The main files is:
  bin/
    www
  config/
    default.json
    production.json
  src/
    schema/
      entities/
      mutations/
      packages/
    ...
  package.json
  ...

package.json - main project config file
bin/www - init start file
config/ - development config files
src/schema/ - contain project schema
src/schema/entities/ - put your model here
src/schema/mutations/- put your custom mutations here
src/schema/packages/ - contain GenUML configuration

development-issues/write-fisrt-oda-app/c.title: Creating schema

development-issues/write-fisrt-oda-app/m.title: More about relations
development-issues/write-fisrt-oda-app/m.body:
Relation
Example relation field.
Note:

Source relation - it mean relation Master model
Target relation - it mean relation Slave model

    ...
      profile: {
        indexed: true,
        relation: {
          hasOne: 'StudentProfile#',
        },
      },
    ...

Noote: field with relation section should contain flag indexed: true.
Relation section can contain:

hasOne or hasMany(Source relation) or belongsTo or belongsToMany(Target relation) - type of relation
oposite - use only with Target relation. It conain name of field in Source relation's entity where it relation can be find.
using - use only for many-to-many relations. It contain: 
  using: 'NameTableBundle#idFieldName'

1)  - name of table bundle. It entity can be create manualy or ODA create it automaticaly
2)  - name of id that use for bind or empty.
Note: By default  is 'id'. Leave the field empty:
   using: 'NameTableBundle#'



Type of relations:
ODA use one-to-one(1 : 1), one-to-many(1 : n) and many-to-many(m : n) relations
Relation one-to-one(1 : 1)
Description points of relation.



Entity 1
Entity 2




hasOne: #
belongsTo: #



oposite: 



Example: 
Student relations with StudentProfile.File Student.ts:
    ...
    profile: {
      indexed: true,
      relation: {
        hasOne: 'StudentProfile#',
      },
    },
    ...

File StudentProfile.ts:
    ...
    student: {
      indexed: true,
      relation: {
        belongsTo: 'Student#',
        opposite: 'profile',
      },
    },
    ...

All descriptions you can find by link One-To-One Associations
Relation one-to-many(1 : n)



Entity 1
Entity 2




hasMany: #
belongsTo: #



oposite: 



StudentsGroup has many Students. Student belongs to one StudentsGroup.File StudentsGroup.ts:
    ...
    students: {
      indexed: true,
      relation: {
        hasMany: 'Student#',
      },
    },
    ...

File Student.ts:
    ...
    group: {
      indexed: true,
      relation: {
        belongsTo: 'StudentsGroup#',
        opposite: 'students',
      },
    },
    ...

All descriptions you can find by link One-To-Many Associations
Relation one-to-many(m : n)



Entity 1
Entity 2




hasMany: #
belongsToMany: #


using: #
using: #



oposite: 



StudentsGroup relations with Subjects.File StudentsGroup.ts:
    ...
    subjects: {
      indexed: true,
      relation: {
        belongsToMany: 'Subject#',
        using: 'StudentsGroupSubject#',
        opposite: 'groups',
      },
    },
    ...

File Subject.ts:
    ...
    groups: {
      indexed: true,
      relation: {
        belongsToMany: 'StudentsGroup#',
        using: 'StudentsGroupSubject#',
      },
    },
    ...

All descriptions you can find by link Many-To-Many Associations

development-issues/write-fisrt-oda-app/s.title: Start application!
development-issues/write-fisrt-oda-app/s.body:
Schema generation
For creating and update schema stop server(if it's runnig) and run in terminal:
npm run compile

Run project with command: 
npm start
